result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:15 AM Defendant Wyatt James Blomberg appeared by video.  Attorney Aaron A. Nelson appeared by video for Wyatt James Blomberg.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in court for State of Wisconsin. Victims are present in court. Judge Radtke and DAR reporter appeared via zoom from Tremp County. Court discloses DAR Susan Greiger's daughter works at an attorney Nelson's Law Frim, does not believe it is a conflict. ADA Schieffer and Atty Nelson; no comment. ADA Schieffer opposes Defense's Motion to Sever charges. ADA Schieffer requests 3-4 weeks to respond. Atty Nelson does not object. Court: due by October 20. Atty Nelson: respond by November 11. ADA Schieffer: no objection. Court: Atty Nelson's reply due by November 11. Court sets an oral ruling hearing. Court will be via zoom. Victims will be in person in Pierce County. 11:20
Oral ruling scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Oral ruling on December 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

INSTRUCTIONS TO APPEAR BY VIDEO:

2. Enter meeting ID:  217-410-2574
3. Enter password:  387818
NOTE: To appear by video, you will need a web camera and microphone connected to your computer or phone. If you DO NOT have a microphone connected to your device, follow the directions to appear by phone provided above. If you have a microphone connected to your device, DO NOT also call in by phone. Doing so will create audio feedback during the session.

10:01 AM  Defendant Wyatt James Blomberg in Court with Attorney Aaron A. Nelson.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in Court for State of Wisconsin.  Defense makes motion to dismiss citing statute 971.01(2) and that Information was not filed within 30 days.  ADA Schieffer states as an Officer of the Court Information was filed with the Clerk of Court on July 11, 2022, at 3:47 p.m. and cites case.  Atty. Nelson rebuts and states Information was not visible on CCAP until this morning.  Court allows Clerk to speak re: efiling process.  Clerk did not set internal review and office was not advised that Information was filed so it was sitting in efiling queue.  Court finds appropriate actions taken by the State and denies defense's motion to dismiss.  Court will proceed with Arraignment.  Court notes Count Seven has been amended to Misdemeanor.  Court questions receipt of Information.  Atty. Nelson advises he has received a copy of Information but his client has not and he will not be answering any questions.  Court reads Information to Defendant.  Subject to special appearances, motions and jurisdiction, Atty. Nelson enters NG pleas.  Bond remains.  Court advises further scheduling should be done with Judge Radtke's office.  Adjourned at 10:18 AM
Preliminary Hearing held on June 14, 2022

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: of Judge filed by Atty Nelson
Arraignment on August 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:00 AM  Defendant Wyatt James Blomberg in Court with Attorney Aaron A. Nelson.  ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  S/T Ellsworth PD Patrol Officer Darrin Foss.  Direct by ADA Schieffer.  11:16 AM Defendant identified.  Cross by Atty. Nelson.  Witness excused.  State rests.  No argument or witnesses from Defense at this time.  State requests Court find probable cause and bind Defendant over for trial.  ADA Schieffer states that Count Seven should be a Misdemeanor and requests clerk reject Information.  Requests 30 days to file new Information.  Atty. Nelson reiterates no argument.  Court makes findings; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds Defendant over for further proceedings.  Atty. Nelson notes intent to file Motion.  Adjourned at 11:49 AM  Arraignment scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.

9:31 AM Defendant Wyatt James Blomberg appears in Court, Atty Aaron A. Nelson, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $10,0000.00 SIBS w/NC M.N.D., C.F.M.K., O.R.G., A.W. or M.E.G., no objection. Court so orders. Court adjourned at 9:37 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Initial appearance on May 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
